article_title: Meet the Corporate Board’s ‘Kitchen Junk Drawer’
article_text: M&A executives’ bullish expectations for deal-making activity this year are being tempered by concerns over global economic concerns, financial market volatility tighter debt markets and regulatory pressures, according to Deloitte’s 2016 M&A Trends Report. The survey of U.S. corporate and private equity M&A executives also revealed a continued focus on strategic deals, divestitures and cross-border opportunities and a rising use of data analytics in M&A decision-making.

twitter.description: As new risks multiply, the audit committee has become the “kitchen junk drawer” for many corporate boards, expanding their workloads sharply beyond their core role of overseeing a company’s financial reporting.
twitter.title: Meet the Corporate Board’s ‘Kitchen Junk Drawer’

article_summary:
The survey of U.S. corporate and private equity M&A executives also revealed a continued focus on strategic deals, divestitures and cross-border opportunities and a rising use of data analytics in M&A decision-making.
M&A executives’ bullish expectations for deal-making activity this year are being tempered by concerns over global economic concerns, financial market volatility tighter debt markets and regulatory pressures, according to Deloitte’s 2016 M&A Trends Report.
